results.title: Nepal: where the legends live
results.brief_description: Short documentary exploring the elements which draw travellers from all over the glove to Nepal, including culture, spiritual practices, and the natural beauty of the surrounding land. Narrated by Gunter Less.

results.title: Neorealism
results.brief_description: Documentary exploring the Italian film movement, Neo-realism, which developed during World War II and dealt with moral, social and political problems in real locations. Includes interviews with Roberto Rossellini, Vittorio De Sica, Michaelangelo Antonioni, Pier Paolo Pasolini and Bernardo Bertolucci. Features film clips from Rossellini’s “Rome, open city” and “Paisa” and De Sica’s “Umberto D”.

results.title: Neoplastic Astrocytes
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristic features of astrocytes in astrocytomas, glioblastomas and astroblastomas. Coloured Bodian preparations are shown for comparison with the living cells. The form density and activity of neoplastic astrocytes and component elements are revealed. The film concludes with two typical astrocytes.

results.title: Nenette and Boni [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Dacia Films, La Sept Cinema, Canal+, Centre National de la Cinematographie, Georges Benayoun and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Set among Marseilles’ working class, Claire Denis’ “Nenette and Boni” is a coming-of-age film about a brother and sister who learn to make peace, forming a meaningful relationship out of dire circumstances. Nineteen year-old Boni finds release from his ennui with erotic writings - obsessive detailed accounts of his desires for a married woman. Boni is perturbed by the arrival of his little sister, Nenette, a teenager who is pregnant and in need of his support. Nenette and Boni have been estranged since the divorce of their parents, having lived separately for many years, and their reunion is fraught and even violent, filtered through the pain of their parents’ relationship. As the pregnancy continues Boni becomes increasingly engaged by the idea of the baby, whilst Nenette remains hostile to the idea of motherhood. This film contains some sublimely textural moments focusing on the patterns of the ordinary, cast as beautiful visions that contrast to the drab surrounds of the protagonists’ milieu, even if Denis does at times fail to provide expositional detail that explains the characters’ emotional journey. Winner of top honours at the 1996 Locarno Film Festival and atmospherically scored by the Tindersticks. Cast includes Gregoire Colin, Alice Houri, Valeria Bruni-Tedeschi, Vincent Gallo and Jacques Nollot. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Nelly and Mr Arnaud = Nelly & Monsieur Arnaud [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Les Films Alain Sarde, TF1 Films productions, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica, Alain Sarde and Claude Sautet
results.brief_description: Nelly (Emmanuel Beart) is a woman unhappily married to Jerome (Charles Berling), an unemployed and unmotivated man whose attitude towards her borders on contempt. Nelly is struggling with their financial situation, juggling several odd jobs to make ends meet. One day she meets by chance at a restaurant, Mr Arnaud. He is an elderly, retired judge, reasonably well off and estranged from his wife and children. Arnaud, a complete stranger, offers to pay her debts, no strings attached, and Nelly reluctantly agrees. Intrigued by Nelly, Arnaud employs her to help him record his memoirs. Nelly is depicted as a somewhat aloof woman searching for a connection to those around her. Mr Arnaud is a man near the end of his life, financially secure but dwelling on past regrets, both personal and professional. The bond between them intensifies and as Nelly embarks on an affair with a dashing young publisher, Vincent (Jean-Hugues Anglade), Nelly and Arnoud’s relationship is threatened. Created from an original script, “Nelly and Mr Arnaud” is a gently observed tale about friendship and the vagaries of the heart. This was the last film directed by Claude Sautet before his death. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Nelli Kim
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: Member of the Soviet Union’s women’s gymnastic team at the 1976 Olympic Games, Nelli Kim was 17 when she won two gold medals for her superb performance on the horse vault and for the floor exercises. The slow-motion camera highlights the best moments of her performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Georges Dufaux

results.title: Nell and Fred
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George C. Stoney, Colin Lun and Richard Todd
results.brief_description: Penetrating look at an issues that confronts many people when age and infirmity make them vulnerable. Nell and Fred must choose between doing for themselves or moving under the restrictive car of an old folks home. Their decision will arouse sympathy and understanding.

results.title: Neil Simon's I ought to be in pictures
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Herbert Ross and Neil Simon
results.brief_description: Libby Tanner (Dinah Manhoff), a 19 year old aspiring actress travels to LA to call in on her screen writing father, Herbert (Walter Matthau) who she has not seen since she was 3 to try and get him to help her get into the industry. On arriving there she quickly discovers he is not as successful as she thought he would be, regularly receiving rejection letters from networks and barely holding down a relationship to make-up artists to the stars Steffy Blondell (Ann-Margret). Father and daughter have a lot to learn from each other and find the answers to why they are they way they are has to a lot to do with the way they interact with each other. As the possibility of becoming getting into acting becomes more real, Libby begins to question her motives for coming to Hollywood. Screenplay by Neil Simon.

results.title: Neighbours = Love your neighbour
results.brief_description: A parable in which two men, neighbours, quarrel about a flower that springs up exactly over the boundary line that divides their gardens. The quarrel grows intensely fierce, each liquidates the other’s family and finally each other. The final scene shows their adjoining graves above which the flower grows again. In this film McLaren has used his “pixillation” technique in which the principles of animation, normally used to put drawings or puppets into motion, are used to animate the lives of human beings. The film has neither dialogue nor commentary, the visuals being accompanied by synthetic music, drawn directly on the film base, and sound effects.

results.title: Negro slavery
results.brief_description: The decision of the English colonists in the seventeenth century to use Africans as slaves would eventually challenge the most fundamental tenets of American life. This film analyses the institution of slavery, shows how it came to divide the nation, and how it helped to create some of the tensions that exploded in to the Civil War.
